kickstart.description: The VNC roll. Setup a simple XFCE desktop and TigerVNC.
kickstart.post:
# default: off service vnc { flags = REUSE socket_type = stream wait = no user = nobody server = /usr/bin/Xvnc server_args = -geometry 1024x768 -fp catalogue:/etc/X11/fontpath.d,built-ins -desktop "Rocks" -inetd -query localhost -SecurityTypes=VenCrypt,TLSNone disable = no }
# default: off service vnc-nocrypt { flags = REUSE socket_type = stream wait = no user = nobody server = /usr/bin/Xvnc server_args = -geometry 1024x768 -fp catalogue:/etc/X11/fontpath.d,built-ins -desktop "Rocks" -inetd -query localhost -SecurityTypes=None disable = no }
vnc 5901/tcp # VNC vnc-nocrypt 5902/tcp # VNC unencrypted novnc 6080/tcp # novnc html5 to vnc proxy
# Always block remote access to vnc-nocrypt!!! vnc-nocrypt : 127.0.0.1 : ALLOW # change this rule to whitelist external clients # see the vnc-roll contrib section on how to auto whitelist client IPs based # on successful ssh logins. vnc novnc : &Kickstart_PublicNetwork;/&Kickstart_PublicNetmask; : ALLOW vnc novnc vnc-nocrypt : ALL : DENY
WEBSOCKIFYARGS="--web /usr/share/novnc/html/ 6081 localhost:5902"
foreground = no cert = /etc/pki/tls/certs/stunnel-novnc.pem key = /etc/pki/tls/certs/stunnel-novnc.key pid = /tmp/stunnel.pid setuid = nobody # avoid POODLE vuln in sslv3 sslVersion = TLSv1
[novnc] # this corresponds to the port for novnc in /etc/services # and access list in /etc/hosts.allow. accept = novnc connect = localhost:6081
#!/bin/sh # # chkconfig: 35 99 99 # # description: Stunnel novnc proxy # # Control the proxy providing encryption and tcp-wrapper control # in front of novnc. # . /etc/rc.d/init.d/functions
case "$1" in start) if [ ! -e /etc/pki/tls/certs/stunnel-novnc.key ] then echo "generating self signe key" openssl req -x509 -nodes -batch -days 365 -newkey rsa:2048 \ -keyout /etc/pki/tls/certs/stunnel-novnc.key \ -out /etc/pki/tls/certs/stunnel-novnc.pem fi
action "Starting stunnel:" stunnel /etc/stunnel/stunnel-novnc-proxy.conf
touch /var/lock/subsys/stunnel ;;
stop) action "Stopping stunnel:" pkill stunnel
rm -f /var/lock/subsys/stunnel ;;
*) echo "Usage: $0 {start|stop}" RETVAL=1 esac
exit $RETVAL
# GDM configuration storage
[daemon]
[security] DisallowTCP=false
[xdmcp] Enable=true Port=177
[greeter]
[chooser]
[debug]
/sbin/chkconfig --add xinetd /sbin/chkconfig xinetd on /sbin/chkconfig --add stunnel-novnc-proxy /sbin/chkconfig stunnel-novnc-proxy on /sbin/chkconfig --add novnc /sbin/chkconfig novnc on
